intro: Cayaponia lhotzkyana, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and climbing habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are slender and twining. Cayaponia lhotzkyana is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil conditions.
